title: This ban system is a joke...
body:
In this game, people who snap at a troll who goes around feeding their lane and call them out, maybe get angry and tell him to stop are more likely to get baned than the troll himself...

Seriously, RIOT, your whole system is a freaking joke. 
I reported 5 people who trolled ranked going 0/13 or even worse lately, and I just checked, all of them are STILL ALLOWED TO PLAY and PLAY RANKED!

But I bet if I would have called them Assholes, Jerks or Idiots, I would already be ranked and chat banned.

replies.body:
Oh, you don't actually know how the report system works, but will still insist it's a joke.

The joke would be if it banned anyone off of a single report, that would make it a joke.

Instead it requires multiple people reporting, and if you are say, the boy who cried wolf kind of reporter, your reports don't mean as much as a regular players would.


So, report and move on, Don't know what moron obsesses over people like this, but it isn't healthy.
Mute, report and move on. You are welcome.
How is that going to help against kids which troll/feed on purpose to lose a game?

> [{quoted}](name=Dextix LT,realm=EUNE,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=000a0000,timestamp=2015-09-24T18:13:31.305+0000)
>
> How is that going to help against kids which troll/feed on purpose to lose a game?

How is flaming and getting yourself banned/reported going to help against kids which troll/feed on purpose to lose a game?

Should Riot do something about trolls? Yes
Does you flaming them help? No
Because you shouldn't be getting banned for having a natural reaction to someone intentionally trying to make you unhappy.

Who is to say trolling isn't a natural reaction? I mean, people have a reason to do it, and they do it consistently across cultures. Just because something is "natural", and there is absolutely 0 evidence supporting it is a 100% "natural" reaction and could very well have heavy cultural influence, doesn't mean it's okay.

Someone punches you, you want to swing back. Is that natural? Yes. Is it productive? No. We have laws for a reason, because an {{champion:161}}  for an {{champion:161}} leaves everyone {{champion:64}} , etc. Look at the chaos revenge murders cause.

Are you comparing the long term physiological effects of rape to the long term physiological effects of having a troll in one of your games? Or are you comparing being physically assaulted to having an unwinnable match?

Extremely poor choice of comparison.

Trolling isn't a natural reaction. It's not a reaction. It's not natural. Are most or even half of players trolls? No. Ergo not natural... It's not a reaction. Like. Come on lol. Nothing in their brain is like "that stimulus has caused dem nerves to wiggle mannnn. That's why we troll!"

lol.. If most or half of the population are not doing a thing, it's not natural! Logic! Because as we all know, 50% or more of the population of any given species have to do a thing before it's considered natural. What 2nd hand textbooks are they using at your high school? 

Anyway, cussing someone out for making you mad isn't a reaction, either. You make a decision to be a dick back to someone who is being a dick to you. You can also choose not to be a dick. There is choice, ergo it is not a reaction. When you make the decision to fan the flames, you are making the game less enjoyable for everyone no matter how "natural" or "justified" your action may be.

FURTHERMORE, you say making the decision to troll is not a reaction. You are correct in that, strictly speaking, a reaction does not involve choice. It is an instantaneous, programmed response to a stimuli. This thread has been using the term reaction very loosely, as well as the term natural. But the choice to troll people has a stimuli, somewhere down the line, which prompted the person to decide that this behavior was worth the effort, and it's no less "natural" than getting mad at the troll and deciding to troll back or cuss them out.

Except anger is a natural emotion.  Have you ever heard of the term "fighting words?"  It basically means if you do or say something with the intention of getting a violent reaction, and you get said violent reaction, nobody (not even the justice system) feels bad for you.

Thank god idiots like you don't run the world.  You sound like an arrogant teenager who watches reruns of Frazier to feel like they are smart.

According to your ham-fisted logic eating is a choice too.

Doing what is "natural" isn't necessarily good. Everyone should always be sportsmanlike and courteous. If an idiot gets on the game, does that mean you are allowed to descend to their level of ignorance? Be better.
I swear officer, I had to wish death threats upon him, he was doing something I don't like!
Not illegal where I'm from. So that argument doesn't hold weight.
threatening isn't illegal where you are? You live in north korea?

No, it's just the laws are cloudy enough here you can get out of it with relative ease. I was also misread and was stating as if operating under the whole online suicide anti bullying thing. In that case, you need to be proven as the definitive cause that triggered the suicide. If they were bullied in any other places, you can get out of it, because you very well could have had no impact on it in actuality. And since they are dead, they can't contest the case.

And no, they didnt have a "bad game" the ran into 5 people without even using a single skill, they had no intention to fight!

Just some of the games I have to play IN RANKED!
http://www.bilder-upload.eu/upload/f4b614-1443103439.jpg


And all of them are still playing...

http://img2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130904185235/spiderman/images/4/44/Meme_poker_face_%282%29.png

So why are you posting this on a lvl 12 account rather than on your own actual one?

> [{quoted}](name=For Carthage,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-09-24T17:17:20.673+0000)

Cause I am from EUW not NA.
This is my Forum account, cause I prefere the NA Forum over the silly EU Forum

You're able to post on all forums with both accounts.

Try it.

> [{quoted}](name=For Carthage,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=0001000100000000,timestamp=2015-09-24T17:20:05.140+0000)
>

> 
> Try it.

Ah. Must have been changed when they switched from the old forums to the Boards...
Damn I am old xD
http://www.troll.me/images/classy/indeed-old-sport.jpg
just another average day in bronze *deep sigh*

It's funny you are complaining about the people you highlighted yet when I look at the KDA of the rest of the teams, they are pretty bad as well.   Like, just cause you have 11 kills doesn't mean you should have 11 deaths to go with it.
perhaps that 0/51 person fed everyone on the entire enemy team, allowing the enemies to snowball to the point of being gods.

All of them combined didn't die 51 times, what are you on about?

Theoretically if someone did die 51 times, they'd be worth less than a cannon minion. They'd get there in about 10 death's too.

Dude. Look at the picture.
Top left Jax is 0/55/1
Followed by 0/47/1 Olaf
0/31 Ryze
0/67 kassadin

Still give more gold, gives your team an afked so the enemy of said feeder can keep farming. And dying still provides xp for the opponent and puts your team on tilt. YOu can't mute feeders.

No, you're looking at their KDA as a single number.

Jax is 3/11/3, which works out to 0.55 kills or assists per death
Olaf is 2/15/5, which works out to 0.47 kills or assists per death
Ryze is 0/13/4, which works out to 0.31 kills or assists per death
Kassadin is 2/9/4, which works out to 0.67 kills or assists per death

As you look through the games you see other players with similarly upside-down KDA number, particularly in the Ryze game, but also Lulu from the Jax one. While with fewer death's, a quick glance at your match history found a few games with similarly upside-down KDA numbers. Same with my games. That's why it's hard to systematically look at post game numbers and label someone as an intentional feeder, and why the feeder detection is just coming out this patch.

At first I was looking at the first line, and my thoughts were "damn, 0/61, 0/55, this guy really meets a high concentration of trolls... but why do they all have 1 AND ONLY 1 assist?
Then  I noticed the little things written beneath, and I was like "oh... oh."
o__o
Yep, there's many good reasons why they are not banned.

people need to learn, calling people assholes will get you banned. Saying you should die is awful. 
But things like "i hope your next taco is soggy and moist," that is a threat that can't be taken out of context, and has comedic value. That's all people need to do, passive aggressive keeps you sane, and a laugh a lot of times brings your own anger down.
"you account should be like graves's cigar"
Passive aggressive is a person with mental issue's way of dealing with stressful situations.

> [{quoted}](name=TenSlashTen,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2015-09-24T16:01:32.730+0000)
>
> Passive aggressive is a person with mental issue's way of dealing with stressful situations.

Some might say the statement you just said is passive aggressive, so are you admitting to something?

> [{quoted}](name=TenSlashTen,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=00050001,timestamp=2015-09-24T16:01:32.730+0000)
>
> Passive aggressive is a person with mental issue's way of dealing with stressful situations.

.>_> that is a literal passive aggressive way of saying I am mental.... Irony?

I wrote a lengthy post about some friends of friends having mental issues and that they're always passive aggressive even if they're nice at first and that makes me assume most people are passive aggressive with mental issues because everyone I've met with mental issues is passive aggressive up until this point in my life.


Talk is cheap but my ears don't lie.
People can say w/e they want but thats what I've experienced thus far.
I'd prefer to go off of experience then take someones word for it.

Idk where my post went honestly.
I thought i pressed save or... I don't know... anyway...
*cough* confirmation bias *cough*

> [{quoted}](name=Boulderox,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-09-24T15:21:32.476+0000)
>
> people need to learn, calling people assholes will get you banned. Saying you should die is awful. 
> But things like "i hope your next taco is soggy and moist," that is a threat that can't be taken out of context, and has comedic value. That's all people need to do, passive aggressive keeps you sane, and a laugh a lot of times brings your own anger down.
> "you account should be like graves's cigar"

l0l calling someone an asshole gets you banned? What is this? Elementary school?
Telling someone to go die and get cancer, sure. Although I personally don't give a fuck what they say to me. 
"I hope your taco is moist" lmfao. You go say that. I'll just avoid it to keep some of my dignity. LOL.

Lmk when calling someone an asshole (even in real life) will get someone to snap at you back. They simply don't care because its not offensive. 
When was the last time you called someone an asshole or bitch and they snapped back at you? Never.

If your at work and you call your coworker an "piece of shit" or "an asshole" Your more than likely gonna get written up, talked to, and possibly fired. However you say something passive aggressive like the previously stated "I hope your next taco is moist and soggy" You can't get written up you didn't say anything offensive, but you get to threaten them and makes you feel better. Achieving the same end goal without the repercussions.

> [{quoted}](name=sreggad,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=000500000001,timestamp=2015-09-25T02:02:37.694+0000)
>
> If your at work and you call your coworker an "piece of shit" or "an asshole" Your more than likely gonna get written up, talked to, and possibly fired. However you say something passive aggressive like the previously stated "I hope your next taco is moist and soggy" You can't get written up you didn't say anything offensive, but you get to threaten them and makes you feel better. Achieving the same end goal without the repercussions.

That's a professional environment. This is a gaming environment. That's two totally different things. Not to mention co-workers are more than likely not going to set you up to fail at everything you do, like feeders do.

why can't it be a professional environment? why can't people talk to others with respect? Honestly it is that kind of logic that gets us with these posts. The whole concept of "it's the internet, get over it" just adds fuel to the fire as you ignore the situation with out fixing anything and allowing it to escalate.

> [{quoted}](name=BakedLotion,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-09-24T15:30:33.227+0000)

you realize that is where the disconnect is, a prim and proper family that never swear or cuss exist, while such as my life swearing is in my nature and family life with no intention. But in the end it is the victim that can convey it to riot for you to get banned, so yes asshole can get you in the deep one with some people where most it does not.

Okay so some guy purposely feeding, and when you call him an asshole, he can choose whether or not you get banned?
I'll be sure to go feed and report everyone who calls me an asshole. Cause I totally don't deserve to be called an asshole for being an asshole!!!

> [{quoted}](name=BakedLotion,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=0005000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-24T17:02:49.031+0000)

so is a lvl 30 BRAND new player that only played bots and hops into ranked. they feed, it may not be intentional, but that's how it is. Also the matter is one report isn't enough on its own 2 or 3 greatly increase the likelyhood of banning, that is why ranked is so ban happy because they are not afraid to 4 man report the one dude that fed. 

Unless the dude literally says "I am/will/going to feed" there is no evidence that they aren't actually trying.
where if a new player is being criticized for trying, that only worsens the future problem with the community

trolls suck, feeders suck, but there is little in place to separate trolls from unskilled players.

My roommate and gf are trying to play league now, they go 1/15/3 on beginner bots, that is feeding, but they are trying to get the tactics down, they don't know how to play. It is brand new. They are unskilled. but you need to fail to get better as a new player.

 If trolls REALLY bother you, after the game, stay in lobby check there name on lolking or what ever, check there matches, how far apart, if they do things that LOOK troll and are troll, report with that info in it, there games were shotty, they built weird on x y z champs. More info can help riot actually bust TRUE trolls. 

I hope that helps

I said PURPOSELY feeding. Some guy is running down mid to their tower. Oh sure! They just suck at the game!!!!
No. That doesn't make sense. Even a level 5 can understand that you don't run down mid lane and die to the opponent. That's not trying.

I'm at a MMR where everyone is gold or above in normals. They know how to play the game. Stop trying to make up some lame excuse and scenario where the guy is actually trying. It's stupid.

Like I said, i'll just go running down mid lane and claim I'm trying. Since that's what you meant. No evidence right?

done, can't help without getting backlash, but elo and rank means shit when you can pay for people to get you diamond. so you ahve bronze as a diamond then.
Figure something out ON YOUR OWN

> [{quoted}](name=Boulderox,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=0005000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-24T20:01:46.261+0000)

Still didn't answer my question. Running down mid lane means they're trying right? 
Nice job dodging the question and the whole point of my post.

For doing that people get banned eventually. Flaming at them accomplishes nothing, they just get what they want: attention and dragging you down with them. For the part where you get banned for flaming them, think of it this way: your teammates try their best to ignore the troll, but you are making the whole experience a lot worse by ranting about it. Even in real life we can't properly punish all assholes and pricks, with the anonomity of the internet they have a lot easier time. Also Lyte hinted that if everything goes well we MIGHT get the tribunal voting before the end of the year.
I had this 1/21 draven who gave up and started running down mid after his 1st death...still playing...

I wish it actually felt like a report did anything.

Going into a low level nrmal game with a plat on your team who is duoing with their friend who just spends the whole game insulting everyone for being below level thirty and not understanding the game as well as them. < This should not be allowed, yet they can do it once, just for the "lols" as they told me, and nothing will happen to them.

> [{quoted}](name=Riv x Kobe,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=A4EOyv88,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2015-09-24T18:12:09.035+0000)
>
> I wish it actually felt like a report did anything.

Agreed. I have said it many, MANY times.. I think this is the biggest problem with moving from tribunal to where we are now..

When tribunal was active, you could SEE (eventually) the result of the reports.

The ban system has always been a joke and all Riot did to rectify it was remove the one place players could influence the community - the tribunal. 

I cannot fathom that riot could possible be this stupid, so my only theory is that there are so many trolls that to ban them would cause a drop in revenue so they refuse to even acknowledge the problem.
